inventory_service package

Submodules

inventory_service.inventory module

inventory_service.inventory.add_inventory()[source]

Add a new inventory item.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the inventory item

  • category (str) – The category of the inventory item

  • price (float) – The price of the inventory item

  • description (str) – A description of the inventory item

  • count (int) – The count/quantity of the inventory item

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad request, 403 for unauthorized access, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the newly created inventory item

Return type:

flask.Response

inventory_service.inventory.delete_inventory(inventory_id)[source]

Delete an existing inventory item.

Parameters:

inventory_id (int) – The ID of the inventory item to delete

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 403 for unauthorized access, 404 if inventory item is not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

Success message confirming the deletion

Return type:

dict

inventory_service.inventory.get_inventory()[source]

Retrieve all inventory items.

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of all inventory items

Return type:

flask.Response

inventory_service.inventory.get_inventory_by_id(inventory_id)[source]

Retrieve an inventory item by its ID.

Parameters:

inventory_id (int) – The ID of the inventory item to retrieve

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 404 if inventory item is not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the inventory item

Return type:

flask.Response

inventory_service.inventory.get_inventory_by_name(name)[source]

Retrieve an inventory item by its name.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the inventory item to retrieve

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 404 if inventory item is not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the inventory item

Return type:

flask.Response

inventory_service.inventory.update_inventory(inventory_id)[source]

Update an existing inventory item.

Parameters:

  • inventory_id (int) – The ID of the inventory item to update

  • name (str, optional) – (Optional) The updated name of the inventory item

  • category (str, optional) – (Optional) The updated category of the inventory item

  • price (float, optional) – (Optional) The updated price of the inventory item

  • description (str, optional) – (Optional) The updated description of the inventory item

  • count (int, optional) – (Optional) The updated count/quantity of the inventory item

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad request, 403 for unauthorized access, 404 if inventory item is not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the updated inventory item

Return type:

flask.Response
